page.title: 04WADWORTH HALL
page.content: Little is known about the earlier buildings which stood on this site. The present Georgian Mansion was built by a family called Wordsworth. Building commenced between 1745 and 1750.The architect is believed to be James Paine the same person who designed Nostel Priory and the Mansion House in Doncaster.The entrance leads you straight into the forecourt with two houses at either side.The houses are two storey pavilions with blanked arch windows and doorways looking at each other across the forecourt.The drain-pipes are decorated with animals, which have survived over the years.The symmetry is very good,but the side of the house looks odd as though another piece was added on.In 1957 it was bought to use as a home for the aged.Now it is used as offices by T.J.Johnson architects.
